content:
SubjectIdentifierOrKey Class

Definition

The SubjectIdentifierOrKey class defines the type of the identifier of a subject, such as a CmsSigner or a CmsRecipient. The subject can be identified by the certificate issuer and serial number, the hash of the subject key, or the subject key.

In this Article

public sealed class SubjectIdentifierOrKey
Inheritance
Object
SubjectIdentifierOrKey

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object, Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object, Object)
ToString()

Properties

Type

The Type property retrieves the type of subject identifier or key. The subject can be identified by the certificate issuer and serial number, the hash of the subject key, or the subject key.

public System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierOrKeyType Type { get; }
Value
SubjectIdentifierOrKeyType

A member of the SubjectIdentifierOrKeyType enumeration that specifies the type of subject identifier.

Value

The Value property retrieves the value of the subject identifier or key. Use the stem.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierOrKey.Type* property to determine the type of subject identifier or key, and use the Value property to retrieve the corresponding value.

public object Value { get; }
Value
Object

An Object object that represents the value of the subject identifier or key. This Object can be one of the following objects as determined by the stem.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierOrKey.Type* property.

stem.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierOrKey.Type* property
 Object
IssuerAndSerialNumber
X509IssuerSerial
SubjectKeyIdentifier
String
PublicKeyInfo
PublicKeyInfo
